summary: The concept of "scholarly writing," which redirects to the preferred term "academic writing," encompasses the structured and formalized expression of research findings, theories, and analyses within the EU legal and regulatory framework. Academic writing serves as a critical vehicle for disseminating knowledge, fostering intellectual property rights, and ensuring compliance with research standards. It plays a pivotal role in the formulation of legal doctrines and the advancement of regulatory policies. By adhering to rigorous methodologies and citation practices, scholarly writing contributes to the integrity and credibility of legal scholarship, thereby influencing legislative processes and enhancing the quality of EU jurisprudence.
